title: Keystore does not load with large amount of keys (using remote folder)
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.10.25`
OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour
Load the entire remote keystore folder that we mounted on the machine using gcsfuse.

#### Actual behaviour
We just decided to upgrade geth from our old version (1.8.16) to the latest version (1.10.25). Everything runs fine except the fact that when we start our blockchain using the mounted storage hosting the keystore, it only starts loading 5 to 10 files then crashes.
It works perfectly with our old version (1.8.16) but does not load properly with the new one (1.10.25)
The error we get when we try to run the command (see command below) is -> No given key or address (but I don't think this error is actually reflective of the real problem)
The folder does contain the wallet we want to unlock but the problem is that prior unlocking the wallet, it does not load the entire remote folder.
Additional infos : with 2000 wallets in our remote keystore it works with 1.10.25, but with 6000+ it does not (but does with 1.8.16)


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
cmd : geth --datadir ./data --keystore ~/bucket-keystore/keystore --syncmode 'full' --miner.gastarget '9000000000000' --port 30310 --http --http.addr "10.132.0.3" --http.port 8501 --http.api 'personal,eth,net,web3,txpool,miner' --networkid 4242 --miner.gasprice '0' --miner.etherbase "XXXXXXXXX" --unlock "XXXXXXXXX" --allow-insecure-unlock  --mine console 2>>/tmp/node1.log 

The keystore is a mounted folder with gcsfuse using google cloud storage

I see no reason why the behaviour would change, since the account/keystore codebase has been very stable. Most likely suspect I can think of would be that dependencies has changed, and of course the golang version. 

Anyway, you say "loading 5 to 10 files then crashes". Could you please provide some stacktraces from such a crash? And also some logs preceding the crash.

Tested using 10K keystores ( locally ) - worked fine. It scanned the keystores in ~15ms: 
```
TRACE[09-27|11:55:00.724] Started watching keystore folder         path=/home/user/tmp/manykeys/keystore
DEBUG[09-27|11:55:00.782] FS scan times                            list=13.592053ms set=38.916232ms diff=5.694102ms
TRACE[09-27|11:55:00.953] Handled keystore changes                 time=171.290214ms
```

Thanks you for your reply @holiman 

The problem is not coming from a simple keystore load but it is coming from loading the keystore from a distant folder.

The folder is hosted on Google cloud storage and we are mounting it on our Linux machine.
With our old version (1.8.16) it load the mounted keystore without any problem.
With the new version (1.10.25), it stops after loading around 5 to 10 files.

It does work with the 1.10.25 version if we load the keystore from a local folder.

As I said earlier, the error we get is 'No given key or address' which is normal because all of the keys (files) are not loaded by Geth when we start it with the distant folder. The error we get is then not reflective of the real problem.

I had to use gcs_debug flag on gcsfuse in order to be able to see what is happening and why it does not load properly the keystore (see attached log on the main post). From there I can see that Geth stops loading from the distant folder after loading a few files. But does work with the older version (1.8.16) 

EDIT :
I just tried using 1.9.25, I have exactly the same problem as with 1.10.25
1.9.18, does not work
1.9.14, does not work
1.9.13, does not work
1.9.12, it works properly
1.9.10, it works properly
1.9.0, it works properly

I expect the problem coming from the changes done between 1.9.12 and 1.9.13
